channel.title: Iphone 5|5S|5C
channel.description:
So i just order myself a 5C and looking forward to when it comes! i was just wondering what you guys thought the best one to get is? in my view i prefer the 5C but i know people have different views so i was wondering what you guys think?
Also if you don't like apple what android phone etc :)

item.title: Iphone 5|5S|5C
item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

Here’s how you fix that…

I had the iphone 5 up until last week, however i also had the 4S. I sold my 4S online for a $175… so i was able to keep my current phone until i bought a new one. Bought the 5S for roughly $215, so i only paid ~$35 out of pocket for my new 5S while still retaining my 5. Pretty cool, right? Well I can keep doing this trend, so long as there are people out there still buying the older iphones, one of my favorite parts about it is i still have a ‘backup’ phone in case something happens to my new one.

Read full topic

item.title: Iphone 5|5S|5C
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

Apple sucks because they are yesterday’s technology with today’s price. They may put out a great phone, they might put out a great OS, but the market is generally at least six months to a year ahead of them.

Read full topic

item.title: Iphone 5|5S|5C
item.dc:creator: @bin703 bin703
item.description:
@bin703 wrote:

[quote=“chillwitm888, post:29, topic:532730”][quote author=bin703 link=topic=651519.msg4372867#msg4372867 date=1381223416]
Can always trust moparscape for a detailed response for these sort of things. Reading through all the posts i have to say that it was extremely interesting to see what you guys had to say. I’ve got my 5C now and i have to say it does not disappoint. the screens display is excellent and the camera is great, apart from a couple of features taken out due to it being a ‘cheaper’ model. However i do strongly recommend it.

Oh and the part were something said your tied into a 2 year contract paying more for the phone…i never heard of Vodafone…50% discount, i’m paying £21 a month over a year.
[/quote] first of all we don’t have a Vodafone and not everybody works for a phone company
Yes 5c doesn’t disappoint if you’ve never used the iPhone 4S and above (iPhone 5=5c but better quality but doesn’t mean 5c is bad)
It’s not worth the upgrade because 5s is out there
Better CPU, better build quality, camera, finger print sensor, gpu, etc
Why would someone get a 5c it’s only 100$ less[/quote]

I’ve owned a 3GS, 4 and 4S all of which i found good at what they did. only issue i found with the 4S is with the ios7 upgrade it seemed to slow down quite a lot and my Facebook etc would take quite a few seconds to kick in. Just because the 5S is out doesn’t mean the 5c isn’t worth it? For one its £100 cheaper and lacks 6-7 features which a 5S has got. So overall the major difference would only be the factor of the finger sensor or the two extra features which the camera has. So in all honesty the 5C in my eyes is the best buy for money. I only say this as from reviews i have read the comments on the fingerprint technology have been labeled a unnecessary feature and i can see where they are coming from to be honest.

Also in comparison from each other the phones differ only a bit but not so much it’s extremely noticeable. i think the main thing which throws people away from the ideas of the 5C, is the plastic casing, because they feel it makes it look cheap but that is the whole point of this version of iphone anyway…for it to be cheap but still a high spec.

Read full topic

item.title: Iphone 5|5S|5C
item.dc:creator: @chillwitm888 chillwitm888
item.description:
@chillwitm888 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:14, topic:532730”][quote author=chillwitm888 link=topic=651519.msg4370049#msg4370049 date=1380415782]

Apparently the 5S performs spectacularly running on a 64-bit iOS. Every benchmark comparison I saw had the iPhone 5S at the top. The 5C is still able to hold well too, considering its a better iPhone 5 for half of the price. If Apple keeps up the progress I may end up getting the next iteration of the iPhone just so I can group message friends without the major hassle of MMS handling my phone has, and then keep my current phone or get an android tablet just to have that OS as well.

wat. iphone 5 has the same cpu/gpu as the 5c they both rock with A6 chips. I think the iphone 5’s chip is slightly stronger actually by a few points comparing my friend’s 5 and in store 5c.
5S has 64bit architecture or w/e. 1gb graphic memory. Just a way better package than getting a 5c. Looks, quality, camera, fingerprint sensor, gpu, cpu, etc
if you really like the blue color just get a freakin case. whats the point of looking at the phones exterior/ non screen part if you are going to cover it with a case anyways.
[/quote]

Also, the iPhone 5S is running the A7 chip, not the A6: http://www.macrumors.com/2013/09/27/a-closer-look-at-apples-a7-chip-from-the-iphone-5s/[/quote]
wait what the 5s i never said it ran the a6 chip
maybe it was vague in my statement but i never said it ran the a6 chip
i stated it had a new architecture + more graphic mem should hint immediately that it is a new chip
@hades i hope you recognize yourself as hugely biased

Read full topic

item.title: Iphone 5|5S|5C
item.dc:creator: @hadesflames hadesflames
item.description:
@hadesflames wrote:

Not necessarily. I'm pretty sure anything that Apple could have copied when the first iPhone was released was from IBM's Simon, Nokia's GEO v3.0 OS and other early smartphones (at least those are the earliest labeled "smartphones". There is every other phone OS inbetween they could have "copied" from). Regardless, very little of any OS is truly original. Hell, the first GUI was copied from Xerox, a scanner company. Is any interface you see, whether its on a Windows, Apple, Linux machine or otherwise, just a shitty, copied version? No, its adapted. Just about nothing you see on your computer was the first of its kind.

My point wasn’t that Apple is unoriginal, it was that they add features at a much slower pace. Even though you can’t argue against the fact they’re unoriginal because, just have a look at their bloody phones…They all look the same…If you go from one iteration of an iphone to the other, it doesn’t really feel like much has changed at all other than a few VERY SMALL things…Also, I don’t just mean going from 4 to 4s or something like that, I mean literally going from 4 to 5, not much at all has changed…You can’t argue against that. Technology evolves and requires change, otherwise people would still be walking around with one of these…

You can just Google chip specifications and you will find what you want. Really, its not that hard. Here, let me help you:
lmgtfy.com

LMGTFY

LMGTFY

More specifically:
http://gigaom.com/2013/09/19/tests-show-iphone-5s-a7-chip-is-dual-core-still-beats-quad-core-android-competitors/

Also, you seem to think that most Android processors are better because they are quad core. Let’s think about this logically for a second - even dual core processors get hot, espeically in a small, enclosed space such as a smartphone. Do you honestly for a second believe that using all 4 cores active would be logical? No, it wouldn’t be. It would generate so much heat in such a small space your phone would overheat without a doubt. The cores may be there, but several are locked. Even on my old HTC Inspire, a single core, 800MHz processor could overheat. When I overclocked it, I nearly bricked my phone because the hardware was unable to cope with the heat. Those extra cores don’t help one bit.

Again, you missed my point entirely, and went off on a tangent about cores. Where did I mention anything about cores AT ALL…?

"Androids" meaning what, the S4? Most Android devices still only come with an 8MP camera sensor, and without broad daylight the quality is sub par. The iPhone 5S's camera has larger pixels, meaning it can take better quality pictures while still retaining the 8MP size. In the HTC One, while they made the pixels larger, they had to downgrade to a 4MP sensor. The sheer number of megapixels doesn't mean anything if the phone isn't able to handle the camera properly. Taking night shots with my HTC One X+ is shitty. The HTC One (And now the iPhone 5S) don't have that problem because of the larger pixels taking in more light. Realistically, that 8MP sensor the iPhone 5S has may just be better than the S4's 13MP sensor.

I fail to see why you would compare a supposed “top of the line” iphone with either an old Android, or a mid-tier budget Android being released for people not willing to drop big bucks on the top of the line stuff. The S4 has 13MP, and so does the HTC one. That’s two more phones for Android than for ios. Not to mention, I’ve not seen any iphone take pics with better quality than my S3. My friend has an iphone 5, I have an S3, both are 8MP, and my pics look better quality and he agrees. Perhaps the 5S can take better pics than my S3 (I haven’t seen any pics off an S3) but it’s not exactly fair to compare a brand new phone to a phone well over a year old now, is it?

I'll give you that, but at least the prices are cut on the previous phone when it still remains steadfast compared to other's today. A 4S is still very good, even though it is 2 iterations behind.

Prices are cut on old Androids too, everything loses value over time. So, what’s your point…?

I'm sorry.. what? Doesn't this apply with nearly every phone on the market? That is the most illogical point I've heard in my life as to why one phone is better or worse than the other. Regardless of what option you take, contract or not, you're still paying for cell phone usage every month which is the same whether there is a contract or not. Buying a phone without a contract is the equivalent to paying for the phone as if you payed for 1 - 2 year's worth of its usage before what you already have to pay monthly. Its asinine.

Based on this reply, I must assume you didn’t bother reading my post at all, but instead just skimmed through it. The point about the contracts no longer had anything to do with why one phone is better than the other. I was simply stating that if you say the absurd prices of the iphone matter not to you because you get it cheap thanks to your contract, then you’re wrong. Also, if you do the math, when you’re locked in to a contract, you actually end up paying more for your phone than if you buy it up front. That’s a well established fact.

Read full topic

item.title: Iphone 5|5S|5C
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

@hades, let me just go over everything you’ve stated:

Because anything Apple releases, Android has had for ages. Take ios7 for example. It's an absolutely horrid attempt of androidifying their overpriced piece of crap phones.
Not necessarily. I'm pretty sure anything that Apple could have copied when the first iPhone was released was from IBM's Simon, Nokia's GEO v3.0 OS and other early smartphones (at least those are the earliest labeled "smartphones". There is every other phone OS inbetween they could have "copied" from). Regardless, very little of any OS is truly original. Hell, the first GUI was copied from Xerox, a scanner company. Is any interface you see, whether its on a Windows, Apple, Linux machine or otherwise, just a shitty, copied version? No, its adapted. Just about nothing you see on your computer was the first of its kind.
Apple doesn't release the specs on their chips. WHY would someone hide that information? The only reason I can think of is because they know they can't compete with top of the line snapdragon chips.
You can just Google chip specifications and you will find what you want. Really, its not that hard. Here, let me help you:
lmgtfy.com

LMGTFY

LMGTFY

More specifically:
http://gigaom.com/2013/09/19/tests-show-iphone-5s-a7-chip-is-dual-core-still-beats-quad-core-android-competitors/

Also, you seem to think that most Android processors are better because they are quad core. Let’s think about this logically for a second - even dual core processors get hot, espeically in a small, enclosed space such as a smartphone. Do you honestly for a second believe that using all 4 cores active would be logical? No, it wouldn’t be. It would generate so much heat in such a small space your phone would overheat without a doubt. The cores may be there, but several are locked. Even on my old HTC Inspire, a single core, 800MHz processor could overheat. When I overclocked it, I nearly bricked my phone because the hardware was unable to cope with the heat. Those extra cores don’t help one bit.

The iphone 5s which was JUST released has only an 8MP camera...Why...? Androids have had 13MP for months now. If iphones are so good, why can't they even keep up on something as simple as the camera department. Didn't Apple used to brag about how top notch their pics were...?
"Androids" meaning what, the S4? Most Android devices still only come with an 8MP camera sensor, and without broad daylight the quality is sub par. The iPhone 5S's camera has larger pixels, meaning it can take better quality pictures while still retaining the 8MP size. In the HTC One, while they made the pixels larger, they had to downgrade to a 4MP sensor. The sheer number of megapixels doesn't mean anything if the phone isn't able to handle the camera properly. Taking night shots with my HTC One X+ is shitty. The HTC One (And now the iPhone 5S) don't have that problem because of the larger pixels taking in more light. Realistically, that 8MP sensor the iPhone 5S has may just be better than the S4's 13MP sensor.
But if that weren't bad enough, they CHARGE you as if you were buying the latest in technological advances never before seen...

I’ll give you that, but at least the prices are cut on the previous phone when it still remains steadfast compared to other’s today. A 4S is still very good, even though it is 2 iterations behind.

You're locked into a 2 year contract to get that phone. You actually end up paying MORE for it than someone who pays for it up front on a carrier that doesn't lock you into a contract, so you're actually worse off.
I'm sorry.. what? Doesn't this apply with nearly every phone on the market? That is the most illogical point I've heard in my life as to why one phone is better or worse than the other. Regardless of what option you take, contract or not, you're still paying for cell phone usage every month which is the same whether there is a contract or not. Buying a phone without a contract is the equivalent to paying for the phone as if you payed for 1 - 2 year's worth of its usage before what you already have to pay monthly. Its asinine.

Read full topic

item.title: Iphone 5|5S|5C
item.dc:creator: @hadesflames hadesflames
item.description:
@hadesflames wrote:

[quote=“Null Amount, post:7, topic:532730”][quote author=krystall link=topic=651519.msg4369270#msg4369270 date=1380282453]
Apple is Shit
[/quote]Okay, cool. Any particular reason, or are you one of the anti-anything-mainstream people?[/quote]

Because anything Apple releases, Android has had for ages. Take ios7 for example. It’s an absolutely horrid attempt of androidifying their overpriced piece of crap phones. Apple doesn’t release the specs on their chips. WHY would someone hide that information? The only reason I can think of is because they know they can’t compete with top of the line snapdragon chips. The iphone 5s which was JUST released has only an 8MP camera…Why…? Androids have had 13MP for months now. If iphones are so good, why can’t they even keep up on something as simple as the camera department. Didn’t Apple used to brag about how top notch their pics were…? Guess not anymore. But if that weren’t bad enough, they CHARGE you as if you were buying the latest in technological advances never before seen…Seriously, only an idiot would pay full price for an iphone. If you’re going to say “well I don’t pay full price…” nonsense, then stop right there. You’re locked into a 2 year contract to get that phone. You actually end up paying MORE for it than someone who pays for it up front on a carrier that doesn’t lock you into a contract, so you’re actually worse off. These are just some of the reasons iphones are absolute shit, I could go on and on for hours, but I’m bored now. Oh, and yes, all of the above DOES apply to pretty much EVERYTHING apple makes. Anyway, if you want to throw your money away on outdated pieces of crap, by all means I couldn’t care less.

Read full topic
